description: CLARA aims to uncover the underlying reasons why potential clients chose competitors or paused their work, gathering insights directly from clients to identify gaps in a value proposition, improve commercial strategies, pinpoint product strengths/weaknesses, pricing gaps, and service and sales deficiencies. By systematically gathering and analyzing feedback, CLARA can enhance strategies, increase win rates, and better serve the market [1, 2].

interview_details.purpose: The purpose is to improve future engagements and the client's feedback is greatly valued [3].
interview_details.recording_policy: The interview will be recorded for transcript use only, and the recording will be deleted once the transcript is downloaded [3].
interview_details.confidentiality: Confirm the confidentiality of the discussion [3].

points: Thank the client for their time and confirm the confidentiality of the discussion [3].
Emphasize that the purpose is to improve future engagements and that their feedback is greatly valued [3].
Briefly recap the opportunity, including the solution offered, timeline, and key decision points [3].

questions.text: Could you share the top factors influencing your decision?
questions.answer: The decisive factors were McKinsey's proven change management methodology, deeper manufacturing industry expertise, and their ability to handle the scale and complexity of our transformation.
questions.evidence: McKinsey had led similar transformations at three major manufacturing companies in our sector. Their change management approach was more comprehensive, and they had the resources to handle our 15,000-employee transformation across multiple sites.

questions.text: How did our proposal compare to the chosen provider in terms of:
sub_points: Product fit/alignment with your specific needs
questions.note: Pricing: Positive, Service capability: Negative, Product fit: Negative
questions.answer: Pricing was more competitive from Korn Ferry, about 20% lower. However, McKinsey's service capability was superior for large-scale transformations, and their product fit was better aligned with manufacturing industry needs.
questions.evidence: Your pricing was significantly more attractive, which we appreciated. But McKinsey's manufacturing practice had deeper operational expertise and their transformation methodology had been proven at companies our size and complexity.

questions.text: Were there any specific gaps or areas where our offering didn't meet your expectations?
questions.answer: The main gaps were in large-scale change management experience, manufacturing operations expertise, and the ability to manage complex multi-site transformations simultaneously.
questions.evidence: While your organizational strategy capabilities were strong, we needed someone who had managed transformations across multiple manufacturing sites with union workforces. The operational complexity required deeper manufacturing expertise.

questions.text: Without naming them, what aspects of the chosen provider's offering stood out to your team?
questions.answer: Their manufacturing operations expertise, proven large-scale transformation methodology, and ability to deploy teams across multiple sites simultaneously.
questions.evidence: They had a dedicated manufacturing practice with former plant managers and operations executives. Their transformation approach included detailed operational redesign, not just organizational structure changes.

questions.text: Did the competitor offer anything innovative or particularly compelling that tipped the scales?
questions.answer: Yes, their digital transformation accelerator program that combined organizational change with Industry 4.0 implementation, creating synergies we couldn't achieve separately.
questions.evidence: The digital accelerator was brilliant - it integrated our organizational transformation with our Industry 4.0 initiatives. This created efficiencies and cost savings that made the higher price worthwhile.

questions.text: How would you describe your experience working with our team?
questions.answer: Excellent communication and responsiveness throughout. The team was professional and showed good understanding of organizational transformation principles, though manufacturing expertise could have been deeper.
questions.evidence: Jennifer and her team were outstanding to work with. Communication was clear, they were always available, and they understood our culture well. The gap was in deep manufacturing operations knowledge.

questions.text: Were there moments in the process where our approach stood out, either positively or negatively?
questions.answer: The organizational assessment was thorough and insightful. However, the operational redesign components felt less developed compared to the organizational structure work.
questions.evidence: Your organizational assessment was probably the most comprehensive we've seen. But when we got into manufacturing operations and workflow redesign, the recommendations felt more generic.

questions.text: How would you describe the chemistry and collaboration between your team and ours?
questions.answer: Excellent chemistry and collaboration. The team worked well with our executive team, plant managers, and union representatives.
questions.evidence: The collaboration was seamless across all levels of our organization. Your team showed respect for our manufacturing culture and built good relationships with our plant leadership.

questions.text: Did any specific interactions, meetings, or presentations stand out positively or negatively?
questions.answer: The executive alignment workshop was exceptional and helped build consensus. The plant visits showed genuine interest in understanding our operations.
questions.evidence: That executive workshop was incredibly valuable - it got our leadership team aligned on the transformation vision. Your team's willingness to visit our plants and understand our operations was impressive.

questions.text: Despite this decision, do you see potential opportunities for us to work together in the future?
questions.answer: Absolutely. We have talent management and leadership development needs where your expertise would be perfect. The organizational strategy work was impressive.
questions.evidence: We're planning a major leadership development initiative next year, and your organizational strategy capabilities would be ideal for that. We'd definitely want to work with you on the right project.

questions.text: What would you need to see from us to feel more confident in choosing us for a future project?
questions.answer: Deeper manufacturing operations expertise, perhaps through strategic hires or partnerships, and proven experience with large-scale multi-site transformations.
questions.evidence: If you could add manufacturing operations experts to your team, or partner with firms that have that expertise, you'd be much more competitive for large manufacturing transformations.
